Description: Part of a convex-sided bowl of fine marlware pottery. There is a slight ridge below the plain rim. The object has been reconstructed from several sherds with one piece separate, but undoubtedly belonging to the vessel. This fragment bears Petrie’s Findspot number 28.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), Findspot 28, under level of chamber 18
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 28 has been scratched on the interior of the separate fragment.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.91, fig.5, p.98, p.102, p.190, pl.32)
Acquisition notes: The item came to the Museum in 1887 but was kept with unregistered material in the Greek and Roman Department. Brought to the Department of Ancient Egypt and Sudan in 2009.
